references.paper_title: Memory aware synapses: Learning what (not) to forget
references.reason: This paper introduces the Memory Aware Synapses approach, a key method in continual learning to address catastrophic forgetting.

references.paper_title: Gradient episodic memory for continual learning
references.reason: This work proposes Gradient Episodic Memory, a significant technique for continual learning that uses episodic memory to replay past experiences.
This paper introduces the a-GEM algorithm, which is an efficient approach that addresses catastrophic forgetting by constraining the gradients of new tasks to those of previous tasks.

references.paper_title: Learning to learn without forgetting by maximizing transfer and minimizing interference
references.reason: This work emphasizes the importance of maximizing transfer and minimizing interference between tasks for effective continual learning.
This paper establishes the strong few-shot learning capabilities of large language models, which are foundational for many continual learning approaches.
